maml:description.maml:para: Uses the much faster FindItems as opposed to FindAppointments to return calendar appointments.
TBD

maml:Description.maml:para: Exchange web service connection object to use. The default is using the currently connected session.
Mailbox to target. If none is provided, impersonation is checked and used if possible, otherwise the EWSService object mailbox is targeted.
Path of folder in the form of /folder1/folder2
Subject of the appointment(s) being searched
Start date for the appointment(s) must be after this date
Start date for the appointment(s) must be before this date
nd date for the appointment(s) must be after this date
nd date for the appointment(s) must be before this date
Only appointments created before the given date will be returned
Only appointments created after the given date will be returned
Only recurring appointments with a last occurrence date before the given date will be returned
Only recurring appointments with a last occurrence date after the given date will be returned
If this switch is present, only recurring appointments are returned
Filter results by custom extended properties.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a single contact in a Contact folder within a mailbox using the Exchange Web Services API
Get a Contact from a Mailbox's default contacts folder

maml:Description.maml:para: Exchange web service connection object to use. The default is using the currently connected session.
Mailbox to target. If none is provided, impersonation is checked and used if possible, otherwise the EWSService object mailbox is targeted.
Email address of the contact to search.
Folder in the mailbox in which the contact is to be searched
Search type determines different orders to search. The default is ContactsThenDirectory
Non-exact match searching.

Set the flag to mark the appointment as an all day event.
Set the flag to mark the appointment to have a default reminder.
Start time of the appointment.
End time of the appointment.
Appointment subject line.
Appointment location.
Body of the appointment.

Whom will get OOF externally. Can be All, Known, or None. Defaults to All.
Start time that OOF replies will be scheduled.
End time that OOF replies will be enabled or scheduled.
Internal OOF message.
External OOF message.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Zachary Loeber Site: http://www.the-little-things.net/ Requires: Powershell 3.0 Version History 1.0.0 - Initial release

maml:description.maml:para: This function uses the EWS Managed API to test the Exchange Autodiscover service.
This function will retreive the Client Access Server URLs for a specified email address by querying the autodiscover service of the Exchange server.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the email address for the mailbox that should be tested.
Set to External by default, but can also be set to Internal. This parameter controls whether the internal or external URLs are returned.

Specifies a user account that has permission to perform this action. Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one from the Get-Credential cmdlet.
Use this switch parameter to enable tracing. This is used for debugging the XML response from the server.
You can use this parameter to manually specifiy the autodiscover url.
Specifies the email address for the mailbox that should be tested.
Set to External by default, but can also be set to Internal. This parameter controls whether the internal or external URLs are returned.

Specifies a user account that has permission to perform this action. Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain01\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one from the Get-Credential cmdlet.
Use this switch parameter to enable tracing. This is used for debugging the XML response from the server.
You can use this parameter to manually specifiy the autodiscover url.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows how to retrieve the internal autodiscover settings for a user.
This example shows how to retrieve the external autodiscover settings for a user. You can provide credentials if you do not want to use the Windows credentials of the user calling the function.
